title: Welcome to tidepredictor
text:
Welcome to tidepredictor

See more in Getting started
A complete reference is available here

title: NetCDFConstituentRepository
text:
NetCDFConstituentRepository(self, fp)
A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.





Name
Description




get_current_constituents
Get the current constituents for a given longitude and latitude.


get_level_constituents
Get the level constituents for a given longitude and latitude.

title: API Reference
text:
UtideAdapter
Adapter for the utide tide predictor engine.


NetCDFConstituentRepository
A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.


get_default_constituent_path
Get the default path to the constituent file.


PredictionType

title: API Reference
text:

Adapter for the utide tide predictor engine.

A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.


get_default_constituent_path

title: Getting started
text:
Install the tidepredictor package from the distributed wheel file.

pip install tidepredictor-*.whl

Copy constituent files (.nc files) to the ~/.local/share/tidepredictor directory.

title: Getting started
text:
Install the tidepredictor package from the distributed wheel file.

pip install tidepredictor-*.whl

Copy constituent files (.nc files) to the ~/.local/share/tidepredictor directory.

title: Getting started
text:
Usage
tidepredictor can be used either as a command line tool or as a Python library.

Python library

import tidepredictor as tp
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

path = tp.get_default_constituent_path(tp.PredictionType.level)

repo = tp.NetCDFConstituentRepository(path)

predictor = tp.UtideAdapter(repo, type=tp.PredictionType.level)

df = predictor.predict(
    lon=0.0,
    lat=0.0,
    start=datetime(2021, 1, 1),
    end=datetime(2021, 1, 1, 12),
    interval=timedelta(hours=1),
)
df


shape: (13, 2)



time
level


datetime[ns]
f64




2021-01-01 00:00:00
-0.312357


2021-01-01 01:00:00
-0.105695


2021-01-01 02:00:00
0.14836


2021-01-01 03:00:00
0.383749


2021-01-01 04:00:00
0.53892


…
…


2021-01-01 08:00:00
-0.08739


2021-01-01 09:00:00
-0.395394


2021-01-01 10:00:00
-0.624534


2021-01-01 11:00:00
-0.71729


2021-01-01 12:00:00
-0.652646






And similar for currents.

path = tp.get_default_constituent_path(tp.PredictionType.current)

repo = tp.NetCDFConstituentRepository(path)

predictor = tp.UtideAdapter(repo, type=tp.PredictionType.current)

df = predictor.predict(
    lon=0.0,
    lat=0.0,
    start=datetime(2021, 1, 1),
    end=datetime(2021, 1, 1, 12),
    interval=timedelta(hours=1)
)
df

Command line

!tidepredictor -x 0.0 -y 0.0 -s "2021-01-01" -e "2021-01-01 02:00:00" -i 30

time,level
2021-01-01T00:00:00Z,-0.312
2021-01-01T00:30:00Z,-0.219
2021-01-01T01:00:00Z,-0.106
2021-01-01T01:30:00Z,0.019
2021-01-01T02:00:00Z,0.148



All options are available as command line arguments.

!tidepredictor --help

                                                                                
 Usage: tidepredictor [OPTIONS]                                                 
                                                                                
 Predict the tides for a given location.                                        
                                                                                
╭─ Options ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│ *  --lon                 -x      FLOAT RANGE           Longitude             │
│                                  [-180<=x<=180]        [default: None]       │
│                                                        [required]            │
│ *  --lat                 -y      FLOAT RANGE           Latitude              │
│                                  [-90<=x<=90]          [default: None]       │
│                                                        [required]            │
│    --start               -s      [%Y-%m-%d|%Y-%m-%dT%  Start date            │
│                                  H:%M:%S|%Y-%m-%d      [default: None]       │
│                                  %H:%M:%S]                                   │
│    --end                 -e      [%Y-%m-%d|%Y-%m-%dT%  End date              │
│                                  H:%M:%S|%Y-%m-%d      [default: None]       │
│                                  %H:%M:%S]                                   │
│    --interval            -i      INTEGER RANGE [x>=1]  Interval in minutes   │
│                                                        [default: 30]         │
│    --output              -o      PATH                  Output file, default  │
│                                                        is stdout             │
│                                                        [default: None]       │
│    --format                      [csv|json]            Output format         │
│                                                        [default: csv]        │
│    --type                        [level|current]       Type of prediction,   │
│                                                        level or u,v          │
│                                                        [default: level]      │
│    --precision           -p      INTEGER RANGE [x>=0]  Number of decimal     │
│                                                        places. (csv only)    │
│                                                        [default: 3]          │
│    --install-completion                                Install completion    │
│                                                        for the current       │
│                                                        shell.                │
│    --show-completion                                   Show completion for   │
│                                                        the current shell, to │
│                                                        copy it or customize  │
│                                                        the installation.     │
│    --help                                              Show this message and │
│                                                        exit.                 │
╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
